intro: Origanum parviflorum, commonly known as narrowflower oregano, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its small, pale blue to violet flowers and aromatic, fuzzy leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. It is valued for its culinary uses and as a ornamental plant in gardens. Origanum parviflorum is also used in traditional medicine for its antimicrobial and antioxidant properties.
